snippet: The clampdown underlined the challenge ahead for Vladimir V. Putin as he reclaims the Russian presidency.
abstract: Vladimir V Putin officially reclaims Russian presidency as protesters continue to clash with riot police around Moscow; he faces a new generation of Russians with no recollection of the Soviet system that shaped Putin's worldview; they do not fear the state, and apparently are prepared to fight for power. Photos (M)d

byline.original: By ELLEN BARRY and SOPHIA KISHKOVSKY; Michael Schwirtz and Andrew Kramer contributed reporting

lead_paragraph: MOSCOW -- In the lustrous, vaulted throne room of the czars who came before him, Vladimir V. Putin on Monday reclaimed the Russian presidency. A 30-gun salute cracked over the eerie quiet of the city, and Russia's defense minister returned to Mr. Putin the black suitcase that contains the controls to a vast nuclear arsenal. Outside the Kremlin walls, Mr. Putin announced his return in another way. The police swept boulevards and squares, detaining anyone they saw wearing white ribbons, the symbol adopted by anti-Putin activists.

headline.main: Putin Takes Helm As Police Punish Moscow Dissent
